isis.stitle: FULL POWER HYDRAULIC ABS BRAKE SYSTEM - REMOVE AND INSTALL - coil for psv

step1.para: Install wheel chocks and turn key off.
Carefully clean the outside of the Pressure Supply Valve (PSV).
Disconnect the electrical connector from the PSV. Refer to FIGURE 65 .
Unscrew the black plastic PSV retaining nut from the PSV. NOTE: This will be easier if the coil is grasped along with the retaining nut. If the nut cannot be loosened by hand, use a strap wrench.
Remove the O-ring and the coil assembly from the PSV core.
Install the replacement coil onto the PSV core so that the connector is correctly positioned (plug is away from the frame and facing the rear).
Place the O-ring on the PSV after the coil, then secure the coil with the black plastic retaining nut. Tighten the nut snugly by hand. Do not overtighten.
Connect the electrical connector to the PSV coil.

Using the EZ-TECH ® and the TOOLBOX™ program clear all brake system related inactive fault codes. (Codes may have been set while disconnecting and reconnecting power to the system.) If active fault codes are indicated, refer to Section 5, DIAGNOSTICS AND TROUBLESHOOTING
to make the necessary repairs .

Turn key on, depress the brake pedal; then, apply and release the parking brake several times to verify correct operation. Also verify that the SERVICE PARK BRAKE warning indicator did not light, and no new fault codes were generated.
Turn the key off and disconnect the EZ-TECH ® from the diagnostic connector.
